title: Does anyone else think that Riot should've prioritize other champions for a rework before Irelia?
body:
I am actually excited that Irelia is getting a change, and can't wait to see her being a true telekinetic blade user (that sure will make her unique), but I feel like there are other champions who are in more serious need of a rework, especially because they lack skill expression. 

{{champion:106}} {{champion:77}} come to mind. They literally do the same thing. Run into an enemy and hopefully win trade by out-statting them. Not to mention, in team fights, they just simply can't run to the back line with the amount of heavy CC, mobility, and utility there is in the game. They are supposed to be juggernauts who can take damage and CC for the team, but unlike {{champion:122}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:420}}, they lack the armor penetration to chunk tanks  and don't have an execution ult.  So even if they have the tankiness of a tank At best they are better for split pushing and clearing waves once they have {{item:3077}} (Udyr doesn't really need it though). {{champion:39}}, on the other hand, at least has a resettable dash mechanic with a tenacity passive to reach the back line, and a 2 second stun that is generally more game changing than anything in Udyr's kit. I also think {{champion:80}} could use a rework. All these champs are much more linear and binary than Irelia personally.

Yeah, on Meddler's post after they announced the Irelia rework I asked him why they chose her when there are so many broken (not op, but fundamentally flawed) champs that are thousands of times worse than Irelia and he basically said she's pretty popular and will bring enjoyment to lots of people, moreso than other champs. Makes sense I guess, most rework characters basically get no play but Irelia is actually kinda popular, especially if you look back at the history of League.

Still, I really think {{champion:82}} and {{champion:20}} absolutely require a rework asap, Morde has literal hundreds of bugs and breaks the game every few patches and Nunu is so incredibly unfun to play as and against that every time I play against him I want to die, as a jungler main.

I mean, I like, never play Irelia, because I don't like her kit. I love her theme and I actually purchased her as one of my first champions (IP) because after 3 weeks she hadn't been free for me to try and I got impatient :P

But yeah, I really hope they nail her theme better with the rework. I want to play her.

>I mean, I like, never play Irelia, because I don't like her kit. I love her theme and I actually purchased her as one of my first champions (IP) because after 3 weeks she hadn't been free for me to try and I got impatient :P

Here's the problem, a lot of people like me are the exact opposite. I play Irelia because I like the kit, I really don't give a fuck about her thematics. 

This is the stance that most people who play Irelia are going to take, they play her because they enjoy her as a champion. If Riot makes a rework that appeals to you they inherently piss off almost all of Irelia's current players.

Is that really the stance most people will take? A lot of people like her for the q which they are keeping. W can easily be a more interesting a ability as well as e. The ult doesn't even feel like an ult.

I think as long as the q is preserved most irelia players would prefer a rework.

Honestly, Riot isn't going to keep a crappy champ with a lot of untapped potential just because she has a small fanbase centered around who and what she is now.

I liked the old Eve and i OTPd her for a time and then all the jungle items started changing (from Magus) and she's gotten nerfed. So from my standpoint, i could no longer play her as an Assassin because any other build on her was more viable and she wasn't as squishy. Still was bad to play as her because building like a bruiser while saying "i'm an assassin" brought a huge disconnect between the champion i always liked.

When her rework came, i was elated. Riot correctly identified her core pillars to keep and rebuild around which meant a lot more cohesive champion with an actual viable kit. Everything about her came together and even her skins (which were either 520 and 750 RP) didn't look cheap.

There's no point in trying to deny a VGU for your favorite champion just because you like her as she is. The majority of people want her to be better and Riot can do better. That includes people who never played her once and people who'd want to try her but don't like the current her. It also includes her mains.

If a large majority of the people want for her to get a VGU, player's satisfaction is going to be served by doing exactly that. Riot can't please everyone and they shouldn't even try. What they can do is to make sure that they don't destroy Irelia's core personality and something in her kit that makes her "HER" so that her small "no change"  fanbase doesn't trash her after her VGU.

Pretty sure thatbmost Irelia players recognize that aside from Q, the champion is a ball of stats that has some unfair mechanics (E stun). Another common complaint of Irelia mains is that W has no scaling, making W max nearly mandatory and polarizing Irelia as a broken midgame champ thats mediocre-bad early and late.

While I understand your position and sympathize with it, I would be willing to bet that if the updated Kit still felt good to play, most Irelia players wont be too upset:

The passive- Im pretty sure that even old Irelia mains aren't going to be too upset with a new passive. 1) There is going to be plenty of Tenacity available in the new runes system, and 2) its not particularly interactive. Im sure whatever they come up with (as long as it is appropriately thematic) will be better for everyone.

Q- Will probably stay in some respect.

W- Not sure what will happen with this skill, I can see the passive staying, maybe "Hiten Style" Will be come her new passive, I dunno.

E- This mechanic is not one that I particularly care for. If the stun duration was based on the difference in HP, I think it would be more interesting, but the long duration stun for simply having less than 1% less max hp than your opponent is unfun in my opinion. I see this skill probably getting changed, though I assume she will still have some kind of cc in her kit.

R- This ability is interesting, but I think it could be better.

Overall, I think that if Irelia keeps her agile fighter feel, the old player base will largely be happier with the reworked version.

Their logic is so flawed sometimes. Irelia is popular because she ISN'T in a terrible spot and can still win matchups.

Champs that are less popular are usually less popular because they are critically flawed, have way out of date kits, or Riot just flubbed them in reworks like Morde. They are so terrible when it comes to context that it hurts my head sometimes.

There's also the need for a firm direction to go with the champ.  Urgot got iceboxed twice before he was finally reworked, and I suspect they don't want to go through that sort of painful process again.  I have a feeling certain champs will sit on the backburner just because building a cohesive kit and direction for them is going to be a lot more difficult and they're just waiting for that one amazing idea to kick them off.

Irelia, on the other hand, is fairly developed, but has lots of unexplored potential.  She is the only champ with a telekinetic blade, but completely fails to use it in the game as such, treating it almost exactly like a normal sword (seriously, imagine swapping it out with a normal sword and see how much it restricts her abilities - it doesn't).  I can see why a team would get excited to update her, and I suspect that had a part in why she was chosen.

Another way of interpreting Meddler's response: Irelia, despite being in a far better state than Udyr or Volibear, does a far poorer job of living up to her theme.

 If you want to play a tanky melee brawler who can run people down and maul them to death, Voli abd Udyr deliver pretty well (not their problem that this strategic role has aged horribly in League). 

However if you want to play some sort of blade mage/dancer, Irelia, on the other hand, isn't anywhere CLOSE to how she could be. She can telekenetically controls blades (which happen to also hold her soul btw) and she never uses them except by holding them all together and smacking people with the cluster, or shooting them in a straight line via her ult.

It's also important to note that the team likely had a passion/desire to work on Irelia and had a base direction to start with. I assume that also plays a pretty sizable part in whether or not a champion is picked. I'd rather the team pick something they know what to do with than sit on someone like Morde with nothing and rush into it.
